intro: Hieracium atratum subsp. pergrandifrons, commonly known as the large-leaved mouse-ear hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with basal leaves that are broadly ovate to rhomboid in shape. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and are surrounded by bracts. It thrives in moist meadows and woodland edges, often forming dense colonies.
